intro: Eritrichium nanum, commonly known as the dwarf biscuitroot, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It has a fibrous root system that helps it survive in harsh environmental conditions. Eritrichium nanum is also known for its ability to bloom early in the spring, making it a notable wildflower in its native range.
